intro: Fagraea philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine star apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The tree produces edible fruits with a sweet, star-shaped appearance, though they are not widely commercially cultivated. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas.
